intro: Papaver tenellum, commonly known as the lesser poppy, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features delicate, nodding flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders. The flowers are short-lived, but their unique appearance makes them a desirable addition to gardens.
